Base class for annotations.

Constant representing garbage label.

Type:

float

Parameters:

  • data (np.ndarray, optional) – Array of annotation data.

  • scheme (IAnnotationScheme) – The annotation scheme used for the data.

  • annotator (str, optional) – Annotator identifier. Will be added to metadata.

  • duration (float, optional) – Duration of the annotation in seconds.Will be added to metadata.

Sample annotation from an interval.

Parameters:

Numpy array of sampled annotation labels. If no annotations are falling in the specified interval an empty numpy array will be returned.

np.ndarray

This class defines the interface for annotation schemes used in the system.

MetaData

Parameters:

  • data (np.ndarray, optional) – The data to be stored.

  • dataset (str, optional) – Name of the dataset the data belongs to.

  • role (str, optional) – ID of a subject in the dataset the data belongs to.

  • session (str, optional) – Session identifier for the data.

class nova_utils.data.data.MetaData(dataset: str | None = None, role: str | None = None, session: str | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

A class representing metadata associated with data instances.

Metadata provides additional information about the dataset, the role of the data, and the session it belongs to. While other modules might rely on metadata information it is important to keep in mind that all metadata is purely optional. Always test a metadata-attribute for None. MetaData can also be extended by arbitrary classes using the expand method.

dataset

Name of the dataset.

Type:

str

role

Role of the data (e.g., training, testing).

Type:

str

session

Session identifier.

Type:

str

Parameters:

  • dataset (str, optional) – Name of the dataset the data belongs to.

  • role (str, optional) – Role of the data (e.g., training, testing).

  • session (str, optional) – Session identifier for the data.

expand(obj_instance)[source]

Expand the current MetaData instance with attributes from another object.

This method allows the MetaData instance to inherit attributes from another object while maintaining its original class hierarchy.

Parameters:

obj_instance – Another object whose attributes will be inherited.

nova_utils.data.session module

Data Storage Class for session specific data Author: Dominik Schiller <dominik.schiller@uni-a.de> Date: 22.8.2023

class nova_utils.data.session.Session(data: dict = None, dataset: str = None, name: str = None, duration: int = None, location: str = None, language: str = None, date: <module 'datetime' from '/Users/dominikschiller/.pyenv/versions/3.9.9/lib/python3.9/datetime.py'> = None, is_valid: bool = True)[source]

Bases: object

Class to stores all information belonging to a specific session during processing

Additional data associated with the session.

Type:

dict, optional

dataset

The dataset or category the session belongs to.

Type:

str, optional

name

The name or title of the session.

Type:

str, optional

duration

The duration of the session in minutes.

Type:

int, optional

location

The location or venue of the session.

Type:

str, optional

language

The language used in the session.

Type:

str, optional

date

The date and time of the session.

Type:

datetime, optional

is_valid

Whether the session is considered valid.

Type:

bool, optional

Parameters:

  • data (dict, optional) – Additional data associated with the session.

  • dataset (str, optional) – The dataset or category the session belongs to.

  • name (str, optional) – The name or title of the session.

  • duration (int, optional) – The duration of the session in milliseconds.

  • location (str, optional) – The location or venue of the session.

  • language (str, optional) – The language used in the session.

  • date (datetime, optional) – The date and time of the session.

  • is_valid (bool, optional) – Whether the session is considered valid.

class nova_utils.data.stream.Stream(data: ndarray, sample_rate: float, duration: float | None = None, sample_shape: tuple | None = None, num_samples: int | None = None, dtype: dtype | None = None, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: DynamicData

A class representing a generic data stream along with associated metadata.

This class extends the DynamicData class and implements methods for working with stream data.

(Inherits attributes from DynamicData.)
Parameters:

  • data (np.ndarray) – The data stream.

  • sample_rate (float) – Sampling rate of the stream.

  • duration (float, optional) – Duration of the stream in seconds.Will be added to metadata.

  • sample_shape (tuple, optional) – Shape of individual samples in the stream. Will be added to metadata.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples in the stream. Will be added to metadata.

  • dtype (np.dtype, optional) – Data type of the samples. Will be added to metadata.

  • **kwargs – Additional keyword arguments for DynamicData.

sample_from_interval(start

int, end: int) -> np.ndarray: Implementation of abstract method to sample data from within the specified interval.

  • end (int) – The end index of the interval.

The sampled data within the interval.

class nova_utils.data.stream.StreamMetaData(duration: float | None = None, sample_shape: tuple | None = None, num_samples: int | None = None, sample_rate: float | None = None, dtype: dtype | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Metadata for a data stream, providing information about the stream properties.

Type:

Shape of individual samples in the stream.

Type:

tuple

num_samples

Total number of samples in the stream.

Type:

int

sample_rate

Sampling rate of the stream in Hz.

Type:

float

dtype

Data type of the samples.

Type:

np.dtype

Parameters:

  • duration (float, optional) – Duration of the stream in seconds.

  • sample_shape (tuple, optional) – Shape of individual samples in the stream.

  • num_samples (int, optional) – Number of samples in the stream.

  • sample_rate (float, optional) – Sampling rate of the stream.

  • dtype (np.dtype, optional) – Data type of the samples.
